text:
Hello all, I'm trying to run a validator on mainnet on docker, and failing.
Do you have an idea what the problem might be?
```SPONSOR_SV_URL=<https://scan.sv-1.global.canton.network.digitalasset.com>                                                                                                                
ubuntu@prd-canton-validator:~/splice-node/docker-compose/validator$ ./start.sh -s "$SPONSOR_SV_URL" -o "<received from sv>" -p "<our-validator-name>" -m "3" -w                                                        
INFO: SCAN address not provided, deriving it from the sponsor SV address: <https://scan.sv-1.global.canton.network.digitalasset.com>                                                                                                                         
INFO: Using version 0.4.2                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
[+] Running 6/7                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
 ✔ Network splice-validator_splice_validator     Created                                                                                                                                                                                              0.0s 
 ✔ Container splice-validator-ans-web-ui-1       Healthy                                                                                                                                                                                             30.9s 
 ✔ Container splice-validator-postgres-splice-1  Healthy                                                                                                                                                                                              6.9s 
 ✔ Container splice-validator-wallet-web-ui-1    Healthy                                                                                                                                                                                             30.8s 
 ⠼ Container splice-validator-validator-1        Waiting                                                                                                                                                                                            105.3s 
 ✔ Container splice-validator-participant-1      Healthy                                                                                                                                                                                             22.3s 
 ✔ Container splice-validator-nginx-1            Healthy                                                                                                                                                                                             11.7s 
container splice-validator-validator-1 is unhealthy                                                                                                                                                                                                        ```
bottom line: container splice-validator-validator-1 is unhealthy

** NOTE: I did not change any configuration file (.env etc)
Also, the SPONSOR_SV_URL I took from <https://sync.global/sv-network/> - mainnet

elements.text:
Hello all, I'm trying to run a validator on mainnet on docker, and failing.
Do you have an idea what the problem might be?
SPONSOR_SV_URL=

ubuntu@prd-canton-validator:~/splice-node/docker-compose/validator$ ./start.sh -s "$SPONSOR_SV_URL" -o "<received from sv>" -p "<our-validator-name>" -m "3" -w                                                        
INFO: SCAN address not provided, deriving it from the sponsor SV address:

INFO: Using version 0.4.2                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
[+] Running 6/7                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
 ✔ Network splice-validator_splice_validator     Created                                                                                                                                                                                              0.0s 
 ✔ Container splice-validator-ans-web-ui-1       Healthy                                                                                                                                                                                             30.9s

 ✔ Container splice-validator-nginx-1            Healthy                                                                                                                                                                                             11.7s 
container splice-validator-validator-1 is unhealthy

bottom line: container splice-validator-validator-1 is unhealthy

** NOTE: I did not change any configuration file (.env etc)
Also, the SPONSOR_SV_URL I took from
- mainnet

text: Hi <@U03T4L2ENVA> off-topic. Curios how are you using KMS now? do you have an enterprise license or you are writing your own kms driver

elements.text: Hi
off-topic. Curios how are you using KMS now? do you have an enterprise license or you are writing your own kms driver

text: The log above looks likely that authentication info is wrong or so. try to check your auth id/client secret, especially ledger user and audience field.

elements.text: The log above looks likely that authentication info is wrong or so. try to check your auth id/client secret, especially ledger user and audience field.

text: but full log will be more helpful as Wayne said.

elements.text: but full log will be more helpful as Wayne said.

text:
Participant helm values

```kms:
  type: aws
  region: eu-central-1
  multi-region-key: false
  audit-logging: false

additionalEnvVars:
  - name: "AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID"
    valueFrom:
      secretKeyRef:
        key: AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
        name: canton-aws-secrets
  - name: "AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY"
    valueFrom:
      secretKeyRef:
        key: AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
        name: canton-aws-secret```

elements.text: Participant helm values

kms:
  type: aws
  region: eu-central-1
  multi-region-key: false
  audit-logging: false

additionalEnvVars:
  - name: "AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID"
    valueFrom:
      secretKeyRef:
        key: AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
        name: canton-aws-secrets
  - name: "AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY"
    valueFrom:
      secretKeyRef:
        key: AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
        name: canton-aws-secret

text:
One more question.

The official guide includes the Validator Node, Participant Node, and Wallet UI / CNS UI.

Just to confirm: Validator Node operators aren't responsible for the Participant Node or Wallet/CNS UI, correct?
Our understanding:
• Validator Node: run by us (infra provider)
• Participant Node: managed by the app developer
• Wallet UI / CNS UI: used by end users

elements.text:
One more question.

The official guide includes the Validator Node, Participant Node, and Wallet UI / CNS UI.

Just to confirm: Validator Node operators aren't responsible for the Participant Node or Wallet/CNS UI, correct?
Our understanding:
Validator Node: run by us (infra provider)
Participant Node: managed by the app developer
Wallet UI / CNS UI: used by end users
